titleStmt.title: A True relation of the inhumane and unparallel'd actions and barbarous murders of Negroes or Moors committed on three English-men in Old Calabar in Guinny of the wonderful deliverance of the fourth person, after he had endured horrid cruelties and sufferings, who lately arrived in England, and is now in His Majesties fleet : together with a short but true account of the customs and manners and growth of the country, which is very pleasant.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Thomas Passinger ... and Benjamin Hurlock ...,

notesStmt.note: This item appears at reel 853:68 as Wing T2970, and at reel 1733:15 as Wing T3011 (number cancelled in Wing 2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
